name: Feta and Zucchini Farinata Pizza (Gluten-Free Italian Flatbread)
author: Fioa
summary: Farinata is a traditional Italian grain-free and gluten-free flatbread, made with garbanzo flour. Top with feta cheese, Kalamata olives, and zucchini slices for a quick and easy Mediterranean-inspired dinner.
directions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Combine flour, water, 1 tablespoon olive oil, garlic powder, onion powder, Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper in a bowl; whisk until smooth
Heat a cast iron skillet over medium heat
Add 1 tablespoon olive oil and swirl around to coat skillet
Pour batter into the skillet and cook until edges are golden, about 2 minutes
Place skillet in the preheated oven and bake until set, about 12 minutes
Remove from the oven and top with zucchini slices, feta cheese, and Kalamata olives
Drizzle with remaining tablespoon 1 olive oil
Return to the oven and bake until golden and crispy, about 5 minutes
